introduction.origin: South Eastern Europe and West Asia

consumption.leaves_and_stem: The fresh tender leaves and stem are consumed as curried vegetable.
consumption.seeds: The seeds are mainly used as spice for flavoring almost all dishes.

plant_description.fruits: legume, long, narrow, curved, tapering with a slender point

species.name: T.corniculata
species.notes: A slow growing type and remains in rosette condition during most of its vegetative growth period.

Climate and Soil.adaptability: Successfully cultivated both in the tropics as well as temperate regions.
Climate and Soil.weather_tolerance: Tolerant to frost and freezing weather.
Climate and Soil.rainfall: Does well in places receiving moderate or low rainfall areas but not in heavy rainfall area.
Climate and Soil.soil_type: Can be grown on a wide variety of soils but clayey loam is relatively better.

Varieties.Characters: Duration of the crop is 90 days. Dual purpose quick growing, suited for intercropping, high seed protein 20-23%. Yield per ha 685kg grain, 4.51 of green.
Duration of the crop is 120 days. High yield, medium height, bushy, suited for pure as well as intercropping. Seed protein: 9.5%. yield per ha 1200 - 1400 kg grain

Varieties.Parentage: Pure line selection from Nagpur type
Varieties.Characters: Duration of the crop is 145 days. High yield, moderately branched, moderately tolerant, to root rot and powder mildew. Seed protein: 21%. Yield per ha 1500 kg grain
Duration of the crop is 68 days. High yield, bushy plant type. Seed protein: 53%. Yield per ha 750 kg grain

Land preparation and sowing.land_preparation: Prepared by ploughing thrice and beds of uniform size are prepared.

sowing_methods.common: Broadcasting the seed in the bed and raking the surface to cover the seeds.
sowing_methods.advocated: Line sowing in rows at 20 to 25 cm apart which facilitates the intercultural operations.

application_schedule.basal: Half of the nitrogen dose and the entire quantity of phosphorus and potash.
application_schedule.top_dressing: Remaining half Nitrogen is applied 30 days after sowing.
application_schedule.for_leafy_growth: Nitrogen should be applied after each cutting.

leaf_harvesting.method: Young shoots are nipped off 4 to 5 cm above ground level.
leaf_harvesting.pre_flowering_cuttings: 1 to 2 cuttings before the crop is allowed for flowering and fruiting.

Harvesting.seed_harvesting: When pods are dried, the plants are pulled out, dried in the sun and seeds are threshed by beating with stick or by rubbing with hands.
Harvesting.post_harvest_processing: Seeds are winnowed, cleaned and dried in the sun.
Harvesting.storage: Stored in gunny bags lined with paper.

Yield.note: For crops grown for both seeds and leaves.

root_rot.control: Drenching carbendazim 0.05% first at the onset of the disease and another after one month.
